title: Parking Lot Notebook.
subtitle: Daily Tip: Use a “parking lot” notebook for racing thoughts.
author: Rhys Morgan
content_html:
Daily Tip: Use a “parking lot” notebook for racing thoughts.

If you’re anything like me, your brain sometimes acts like it’s had five espressos and a panic attack.

Thoughts flying in every direction. New ideas. Random worries. A weird craving for toast.

Instead of trying to wrestle them into silence (which never works), I grab my notebook and write them down. I call it my “parking lot.” It’s a safe space for my brain to drop stuff off while I focus on the thing I’m actually trying to do.

It’s simple. And it works.

Try it today: Keep a small notebook or open a note on your phone. The next time your brain interrupts you with “don’t forget to...” or “what if aliens invented paperclips,” just jot it down and keep going.

Let your brain park the chaos. You can sort

It later.

Thank you for reading.
